intro: Valerianoides quadrangula, commonly known as the four-angled valerian, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its square or four-angled stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Valerianoides quadrangula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
